module.p:
Adjectives –
Tha an cù dubh.
The dog is black. td. 6 ‘cù’ is the subject of ‘tha’ (and ‘an’ is the specifier of ‘cù’); ‘dubh’ is the predicate of ‘tha’.
Tha an cat bàn.
The cat is white. td. 6
Tha an cù mòr.
The dog is big. td. 6
Tha an cat beag.
The cat is small. td. 6
Tha an dorus mór.
The door is big. td. 6 [adapted]
Tha an teine mór.
The fire is big. td. 6

Prepositions –
Tha an cù dubh aig an dorus.
The black dog is at the door. td. 9
Tha an cat aig an teine.
The cat is by the fire. td. 6
Tha teas anns an teine.
There is heat in the fire. td. 6

Conjoined examples –
Tha an dorus mór agus tha an teine mór.
The door is big and the fire is big. td. 6
